meanings.definition: Carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, or course of action)
meanings.sent1: The teacher executed the lesson plan perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The team executed the project with precision.
meanings.sent3: The robot executed the dance moves flawlessly.
meanings.sent4: The chef executed the recipe to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The magician executed the trick with finesse.

meanings.definition: Put to death as a legal penalty
meanings.sent1: The criminal was executed for his crimes.
meanings.sent2: The king ordered the traitor to be executed.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain was executed in the final scene.
meanings.sent4: The condemned prisoner was executed at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The executioner executed his duty with solemnity.
